Pre-Game Insights: Hungary has not kept a clean sheet in their last six games.
Turkey has won three of their last four games in all competitions.
Marco Rossi has a fully-fit squad at his disposal and should be able to call upon all 25 players in this match.
Vincenzo Montella has called up a strong squad and had to replace Cengiz Ünder and Ferdi Kadıoğlu due to injuries.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The hosts are unbeaten in their last 12 games in all competitions, recording seven wins.
The visitors are unbeaten in their last four games in all competitions.
Hungary topped their group tables in the Euro qualifiers, with the hosts enjoying an unbeaten run in eight games.
Turkey suffered just one loss in their Euro qualifier period.
The two teams have met 15 times in all competitions thus far, with six meetings being friendlies.
The hosts have the upper hand in these meetings with a 9-4 lead in wins and just two games ending in draws.
The hosts are unbeaten in their last seven home games in all competitions, keeping three clean sheets while conceding just four times.
Turkey have just one win in their away meetings against the hosts in nine meetings.
